Package de.feu.massim22.group3.map

Class PathFinder

java.lang.Object
de.feu.massim22.group3.map.PathFinder
class PathFinder extends Object
The Class PathFinder handles the communication with the OpenGL library GLFW to create and manage OpenGL Contexts. The Contexts are used to perform calculations by a compute shader to receive path finding information.
Author:
Heinz Stadler

  • Constructor Details

    • PathFinder

      PathFinder(long windowHandler, boolean debug)
      Instantiates a new PathFinder.
      Parameters:
      windowHandler - the handler to the openGl context
      debug - true if the PathFinder should write images of the path finding result to the log/map folder.

  • Method Details

    • init

      static void init()
      Instantiates the GLFW library and loads the compute shader. This method must be called from the main thread.

    • close

      static void close(long context)
      Frees the resources used by the OpenGL context.
      Parameters:
      context - the handler to the OpenGL context

    • createOpenGlContext

      static long createOpenGlContext()
      Creates a new OpenGL context.
      Returns:
      the handler to the OpenGL context

    • start

      public PathFindingResult[][] start(FloatBuffer mapBuffer, FloatBuffer dataBuffer, List<InterestingPoint> goalPoints, Point mapSize, Point dataSize, int agentCount, int goalCount, boolean mapDiscovered, String supervisor, int step)
      Starts the path finding.
      Parameters:
      mapBuffer - the buffer in which obstacles are stored as 1.0f and free cells are stored as 0.0f
      dataBuffer - the buffer with information about agent position and attached blocks to the agent
      goalPoints - a List of Points for which path finding should be started
      mapSize - the size of the map input texture
      dataSize - the size of the data input texture
      agentCount - the number of agents
      goalCount - the number of goals
      mapDiscovered - indicates if the map size is already discovered or not
      supervisor - the supervisor of the group for which the path finding should be started
      step - the current step of the simulation
      Returns:
      a two dimensional Array of path finding results containing the distance and direction of every goal point from every agent
